bug.author: tom-andersson
bug.summary: Passing allow_val_change=True to wandb.init() prevents sweeps from changing hyperparameters
bug.description:
I'm not sure if this is strictly a bug, but it's certainly not what I would expect.
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.3 Python version: 3.7.6 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Passing allow_val_change=True to wandb.init() clamps the config values to their defaults when running a sweep, and thus no new values are used. The command line inputs introduced by wandb seem to be ignored. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
I did the usual of defining sweep.yaml, running wandb sweep sweep.yaml and wand agent <agent_id>. In my train.py script, I print wandb.config after the wandb.init() call, which confirms that the hyperparameters in the sweep are always fixed to the defualt config values that I pass to wandb.init(). Setting allow_val_change=False prevents this unexpected behaviour. I'd expect allow_val_change to simply allow me to overwrite wandb.config values in my training script, but still allow sweeps to run and modulate the hyperparameters. P.S. Thank you very much for making this fantastic package; I'm finally emerging from my cave where I manually tune hyperparameters like a maniac.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.73. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey Tom, thank you very much for reporting! Filing a ticket for this.
HI there Tom, it sounds like you're passing config values to wandb.init()‚Äî could you share your script so we can reproduce this issue?

Thanks for the responses guys and sorry for the delay. It wouldn't be useful for me to share my whole script due to custom code, but I can share the relevant opening lines below (imports included in case someone can spot a potential package issue). I'm now also finding that attempting to overwrite default hyperparam values using command line entries has no effect. Is this expected behaviour? I thought wandb sweeps modify the default values by calling the script with command line entries? When I run the script with --seed=50, say, the result of printing wandb.config shows that only the default value of seed=42 is used. <denchmark-code>import sys import os import numpy as np import json import pickle import argparse import plotly.express as px import warnings import scipy from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score import tensorflow as tf import time import regex as re import xarray as xr from datetime import datetime from tensorflow.keras import backend as K from dateutil.relativedelta import relativedelta import iris import cartopy.crs as ccrs import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import tensorflow from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import ModelCheckpoint from tensorflow.keras.models import load_model import matplotlib as mpl import wandb from wandb.keras import WandbCallback
defaults = dict(seed=42, learning_rate=0.0001, filter_size=3, n_filters_factor=1, weight_decay=0., batch_size=4, dropout_rate=0.35)
wandb.init(project="my_project_name", allow_val_changes=True, config=defaults)
print('

Hyperparams:') print(wandb.config) print('

') </denchmark-code>

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tom-andersson>@tom-andersson</denchmark-link>
I tried reproducing the code. I found a simple synatx error in your code snippet otherwise the code seems to be doing what is expected. <denchmark-h:h2>Train.py</denchmark-h>
import wandb defaults = dict(seed=42, filter_size=3) wandb.init(entity="xxx", allow_val_change=True, project="xxx",config=defaults) print('\n\nHyperparams:') print(wandb.config) print('\n\n') log = 2*wandb.config["filter_size"] - 0.01*wandb.config["seed"] wandb.log({"output":log}) wandb.finish() <denchmark-h:h2>Sweep.yml</denchmark-h>
project: xxx entity: xxx program: train.py method: bayes metric: goal: minimize name: output parameters: seed: distribution: int_uniform max: 100 min: 42 filter_size: distribution: int_uniform max: 7 min: 3 <denchmark-h:h2>Code error</denchmark-h>
wandb.init(project="my_project_name", allow_val_changes=True, config=defaults) The parameter should have been allow_val_change instead of allow_val_changes. When I use the the print statements seem to be printing out the different paramter values as should be <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36856589/101144818-e737d400-363e-11eb-8cd4-f157146d81ab.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36856589/101144890-00d91b80-363f-11eb-93c6-a1285459df54.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36856589/101144954-177f7280-363f-11eb-8134-59d736971090.png></denchmark-link>
We are closing this ticket as the solution is found. Please let us know if the problem still persists. üòÑ
